Class BinarySearchTree

java.lang.Object
BinarySearchTree
public class BinarySearchTree extends Object
The BinarySearchTree class represents an implementation of a binary search tree (BST).

      private Node root
      Root of tree

  • Constructor Details

    • BinarySearchTree

      public BinarySearchTree()
      Initializes an empty binary search tree. Root is set to null so that the BST is empty at the start.

  • Method Details

      public void insert(int value)
      Inserts a new value into the BST.

      value - The value to be inserted.

      private Node insertRec(Node root, int value)
      Recursively inserts a value into the BST.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the current subtree.
      value - The value to be inserted.
      Returns:
      The updated root of the subtree.

      private Node removeRec(Node root, int value)
      Recursively removes a value from the BST.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the current subtree.
      value - The value to be removed.
      Returns:
      The updated root of the subtree.

      private int maxValue(Node node)
      Finds the maximum value in a subtree. Method used within removeRec.
      Parameters:
      node - The root of the subtree.
      Returns:
      The maximum value in the subtree.

      public boolean remove(int value)
      Removes a value from the BST.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be removed.
      Returns:
      The number of nodes in the updated tree.

    • search

      public boolean search(int value)
      Searches for a value in the BST.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to search for.
      Returns:
      True if value is found, false if not found.

    • searchRec

      private boolean searchRec(Node root, int value)
      Recursively searches for a value in the BST.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the current subtree.
      value - The value to search for.
      Returns:
      True if value is found, false if not found.

    • balanceRec

      private Node balanceRec(Node root)
      Recursively balances the BST by performing rotations. Rotations are necessary in order to maintain that for every node in a BST, all the elements in the left subtree are less than the root and all elements in right subtree are greater than root.
      Parameters:
      root - The root of the current subtree.
      Returns:
      The updated root of the subtree.

    • getBalance

      private int getBalance(Node node)
      Gets the balance factor of a node. The balance factor is the height of its left child's subtree minus the height of the right child's subtree. If result returned is positive, left subtree is taller. If result returned is negative, right subtree is taller. If result is zero, both subtrees have same height.
      Parameters:
      node - The node to calculate the balance factor for.
      Returns:
      The balance factor of the node.

    • getHeight

      private int getHeight(Node node)
      Gets the height of a node. Height of a node is the number of edges on the longest path from the node to a leaf. Returns zero if node is null which means it does not exist. If not zero, the height is calculated by taking the maximum height of the left and right subtrees and adding 1. The 1 is for the edge to the parent node.
      Parameters:
      node - The node to calculate the height for.
      Returns:
      The height of the node.

    • height

      public int height()
      Public method to retrieve height using private getHeight method.
      Returns:
      Height of tree.

    • rightRotate

      private Node rightRotate(Node y)
      Performs a right rotation on a node.
      Parameters:
      y - The node to be rotated.
      Returns:
      The updated node after the rotation.

    • leftRotate

      private Node leftRotate(Node x)
      Performs a left rotation on a node.
      Parameters:
      x - The node to be rotated.
      Returns:
      The updated node after the rotation.

    • inOrderTraversal

      public List<Integer> inOrderTraversal()
      Method to return in-order traversal of BST.
      Returns:
      A list containing the values from in-order traversal.

    • inOrderTraversal

      private void inOrderTraversal(Node node, List<Integer> result)
      Helper method for in-order traversal of the BST. In-order traversal visits nodes in ascending order. The order goes left child to current node to right child.
      Parameters:
      node - The current node being visited.
      result - The list to store the traversal results.

    • preOrderTraversal

      public List<Integer> preOrderTraversal()
      Method to return pre-order traversal of the BST.
      Returns:
      A list containing the values from pre-order traversal.

    • preOrderTraversal

      private void preOrderTraversal(Node node, List<Integer> result)
      Helper method for pre-order traversal of the BST. Pre-order traversal visits the current node before its children. The order is root to left child to right child.
      Parameters:
      node - The current node being visited.
      result - The list to store the traversal results.

    • postOrderTraversal

      public List<Integer> postOrderTraversal()
      Perform a post-order traversal of the BST and return the result.
      Returns:
      A list containing the values from post-order traversal.

    • postOrderTraversal

      private void postOrderTraversal(Node node, List<Integer> result)
      Helper method for post-order traversal of the BST. Post-order traversal order goes left child to right child to root.
      Parameters:
      node - The current node being visited.
      result - The list to store the traversal results.
